text: Mehrsa Baradaran (born April 3, 1978) is an Iranian-American law professor. She was born in Orumieh, Iran. She works in banking law at the University of Georgia. Her book How the Other Half Banks has received national and international media coverage. In 2017, Baradaran publicly criticized President Donald Trump and his executive order that allowed an immigration ban. ==References== Category:1978 births Category:Living people Category:Iranian writers Category:Lawyers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Academics from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Naturalized citizens of the United States
title: Mehrsa Baradaran
